oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A microscopic description of absorption in high-energy string-brane collisions
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: D'Appollonio, Giuseppe
Di Vecchia, Paolo
Russo, Rodolfo
Veneziano, Gabriele
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: High Energy Physics - Theory
General Relativity and Quantum Cosmology
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We study the collision of a highly energetic light closed string off a stack of Dp-branes at (sub)string-scale impact parameters and in a regime justifying a perturbative treatment. Unlike at larger impact parameters - where elastic scattering and/or tidal excitations dominate - here absorption of the closed string by the brane system, with the associated excitation of open strings living on it, becomes important. As a first step, we study this phenomenon at the disk level, in which the energetic closed string turns into a single heavy open string at rest whose particularly simple properties are described.
